Package com.im.njams.sdk.communication

Class AbstractReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.im.njams.sdk.communication.AbstractReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpSseReceiver, JmsReceiver, KafkaReceiver
    public abstract class AbstractReceiver
extends Object
implements Receiver
    This class should be extended when implementing an new Receiver for a new communication type.
    Version:
    4.0.6
    Author:
    pnientiedt/krautenberg

    • Method Detail

      • setNjams

        public void setNjams​(Njams njams)
        This constructor sets the njams instance for getting the instruction listeners.
        Specified by:
        setNjams in interface Receiver
        Parameters:
        njams - the instance that holds the instructionListeners.

      • onInstruction

        public void onInstruction​(com.faizsiegeln.njams.messageformat.v4.command.Instruction instruction)
        This function should be called by a implementation of the Receiver class with the previously read instruction.
        Specified by:
        onInstruction in interface Receiver
        Parameters:
        instruction - the instruction that will be handed to all instructionListeners

      • extendRequest

        protected com.faizsiegeln.njams.messageformat.v4.command.Response extendRequest​(com.faizsiegeln.njams.messageformat.v4.command.Request request)
        This method is for extending the incoming request if it is needed for the concrete receiver.
        Parameters:
        request - request to extend
        Returns:
        A response that will be sent back without further processing of the request. If null is returned (as default), the request has been extended successfully and can be processed normally.

      • connect

        public abstract void connect()
        This method should be used to create a connection, and if the startup fails, close all resources. It will be called by the reconnect method. It should throw an Exception if anything unexpected or unwanted happens.

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect​(Exception ex)
        This method tries to establish the connection over and over as long as it not connected. If connect throws an exception, the reconnection threads sleeps for INIT_RECONNECT_INTERVAL second before trying again to reconnect.
        Parameters:
        ex - the exception that initiated the reconnect

      • start

        public void start()
        This method starts the Receiver. It tries to establish the connection, and if it fails, calls the method onException.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Receiver

      • onException

        public void onException​(Exception exception)
        This method is used to start a reconnect thread.
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception that caused this method invocation.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        This method returns whether the receiver is connected or not.
        Returns:
        true, if Receiver is connected, otherwise false

      • isDisconnected

        public boolean isDisconnected()
        This method returns whether the receiver is disconnected or not.
        Returns:
        true, if Receiver is disconnected, otherwise false

      • isConnecting

        public boolean isConnecting()
        This method returns whether the receiver is connecting or not.
        Returns:
        true, if Receiver is connecting, otherwise false

      • suppressGetRequestHandlerInstruction

        protected static boolean suppressGetRequestHandlerInstruction​(com.faizsiegeln.njams.messageformat.v4.command.Instruction instruction,
                                                              Njams targetClient)
        Returns true only if the given instruction is a Command.GET_REQUEST_HANDLER command and the given target client does not support the Njams.Feature.CONTAINER_MODE feature.
        Parameters:
        instruction - The instruction to check.
        targetClient - The client that shall receive the instruction.
        Returns:
        false in all other cases.
